pages.text: Psittacosaurus was a genus of ceratopsian dinosaur that lived during the Early Cretaceous Period (approximately 126-101 million years ago) in what is now Asia. It was characterized by its parrot-like beak, which it used to strip leaves and branches from plants. Psittacosaurus was a small, bipedal dinosaur that likely fed on low-lying vegetation and insects. It belongs to the family Psittacosauridae and represents an important example of early ceratopsian diversity.
